latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Stupak amendment (A007) Agreed to by recorded vote: 348 - 74 (Roll no. 215).
By unanimous consent, the Stupak amendment was withdrawn.
On agreeing to the Stupak amendment (A001) Failed by recorded vote: 199 - 222 (Roll no. 517).
On agreeing to the Stupak amendment (A003) Agreed to by voice vote.

Mr. Bonilla raised a point of order against the Stupak amendment (A020). Mr. Bonilla stated that the provisions of the Stupak amendment seek to impose new duties thus changing existing law and constituting legislation in an appropriations bill. The Chair sustained the point of order.

Mr. Bonilla raised a point of order against the Stupak amendment (A016). Mr. Bonilla stated that the amendment seeks to impose new duties and changes existing law. The Chair sustained the point of order.
On agreeing to the Stupak amendment (A010) Failed by recorded vote: 174 - 253 (Roll no. 209).
By unanimous consent, the Stupak amendment was withdrawn.
On agreeing to the Stupak amendment (A020) Agreed to by voice vote.
